meanings.definition: In an utter or complete manner
meanings.sent1: She arrantly ignored all the warnings and went ahead.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle was arrantly solved by the young boy.
meanings.sent3: The cat arrantly knocked over the vase and then looked innocent.
meanings.sent4: The sun shone arrantly through the clouds after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher arrantly praised the student for their hard work.

meanings.sent1: He arrantly cleaned his room before his friends came over.
meanings.sent2: The chef arrantly mixed all the ingredients for the cake.
meanings.sent3: The dog arrantly dug up the entire garden looking for buried treasure.
meanings.sent4: The music filled the room arrantly, drowning out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: She arrantly studied for the exam and aced it.

meanings.sent1: The arrantly bad movie received terrible reviews from critics.
meanings.sent2: The arrantly behaved child was always causing trouble in class.
meanings.sent3: The arrantly designed building collapsed after a strong gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: The arrantly written book was quickly forgotten by readers.
meanings.sent5: The arrantly painted house stood out in the neighborhood for all the wrong reasons.
